elevator.rmi
Class MotorImpl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
        |
        +--java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
              |
              +--java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
                    |
                    +--elevator.rmi.MotorImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Motor, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable
public class MotorImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements Motor

The class MotorImpl implements the elevator.rmi.Motor remote interface. An object with this class represents a motor of one elevator and is used to control the motor of the elevator and to test position of the elevator via RMI. The object servers as a proxy to the motor of the elevator.

An object with this class is created when a thread invokes the getMotor static method on the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class with the elevator number (1, 2, ...) as a parameter. The calling thread gets a RMI stub of the MotorImpl object with the Motor interface used to control the motor of the given elevator. For example: 

     MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
     int elevatorNumber = 3;
     Motor m = MakeAll.getMotor(elevatorNumber);
     m.up();
     while (m.whereIs() < 2.888) sleep(10);
     m.stop();

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
MakeAll, Motor, Serialized Form

down

public void down()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Start this motor to move the elevator down. If not stopped, the elevator stops automatically when it reaches the bottom floor.

whereIs

public float whereIs()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returs a current position of the elevator moved with this motor.
Specified by:
whereIs in interface Motor
Returns:
a float position of the elevator in "floor units". For example, the value 2.5 "floor units" means that the elevator is located exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floors.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
down, stop, up
